page.title: 14 Radcot area attitudes.
page.content: Local people are saddened by, but accept as inevitable the fact that the empty farm cottages are being converted to weekend homes. There is no pressure for a new bridge to ease the traffic flow but there is a desire for better road signs to warn approaching lorries of the restrictions on the bridges. By the time drivers are aware of the problems there is insufficient room for manoeuvring. One farmer's enthusiasm for conservation is slowly rubbing off onto others. He is willing to accomodate people of all interests on his land even though he may be of a different persuasion. He is not a hunter but allows huntsmen to use his land. Ramblers are welcome providing they use the correct footpaths, follow the country code and show common courtesy.
